page.title: 03 Two of Tamworth's Farms.
page.content: Mr and Mrs Kingslake live and work at {Whitegates Farm}. They grow soft fruit such as strawberries, gooseberries and raspberries. They let a man keep bees on the farm because the bees pollenate the soft fruit. Mr Kingslake has a balloon to advertise the farm. They also advertise on signposts and in the local press. He is only supposed to fly the balloon on Saturdays and Sundays. There are several different kinds of strawberry on the twenty-two acres. The most popular is called Cambridge Favourite. Another kind is Totem which is very good for freezing. The land in the three squares 04220304, 04220305 and 04230305 is generally flat but rising to the north. It belongs to {Amington Old Hall Farm} and is used mainly for growing crops.
